info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 13 at 12:11AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT NORTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA... NORTHEASTERN BEAVER...SOUTHERN LAWRENCE...SOUTHWESTERN INDIANA...SOUTHERN BUTLER...NORTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY...NORTH CENTRAL WESTMORELAND AND SOUTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG COUNTIES... At 1108 PM EST, a band of heavy snow extend from Lawrence county southeastward through Butler, Northeastern Allegheny, Southern Armstrong and Northern Westmoreland counties. The snow within the band was moving southeast at 30 mph, while the entire band was drifting northward. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this squall. Locations impacted include... Cranberry, New Castle, Butler, Vandergrift, Apollo, New Kensington, Lower Burrell, Harrison Township, Ellwood City, Homeacre-Lyndora, Tarentum, and Natrona Heights. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 1 and 18. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 82 and 98. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 13 and 14. Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter of a mile in this squall. A quick inch of snow accumulation is possible. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
